item.title: The Need for Workload Identity in the Private Cloud
item.description: A growing consideration for cloud spending and the proliferation of AI have caused many organizations to evaluate their use of the public cloud. Many are looking at taking better advantage of their existing data centers or leveraging colocation facilities to enable the best of both worlds. Many will state that the cloud isnâ€™t a location but an operating model. This means that companies have adopted operational patterns for managing workloads in the public cloud (location) that would like to leverage in their private cloud. I believe that workload identity is one of those patterns that many would like to take advantage of in their private cloud.
